page.title: 13STREET NAMES IN OUR AREA
page.content: We looked at the map showing all the streets near school and then tried to find out{how they got their}names.This is what we found.8 streets were named after{famous poets}e.g.Tennyson Street Ruskin Crescent Bacon Street.Some were near Nunroyd Park,so they were called Park Road or Park Grove.Cemetery Road was near the cemetery,and Banksfield Avenue was near the hill we call the Banks.Southview Crescent and Close were facing south.Some of the others weren't as easy to work out.There must have been lots of{forests}here before they built the houses where we live because there is Coppice Wood Avenue,Hawthorn Road and Shaw Leys.We found out that Ley meant a{clearing in {the forest.}Newlands Avenue might have been in a clearing.Queensway is a modern road called after our queen. {BY IAN KENNEDY AND STEVEN CARTER
